Testing for STDs

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎04-16-2015 01:44 PM

I know this is way, way off the topic of diabetes, or is it?  Let's admit many of us have had sex if and when we are or were single.  I've been tested or HIV several times over the last 10 years because I have had blood transfusions about 10 years ago.  I know the blood supply is the safest is ever has been, but I don't want to take a chance the lab made a mistake...and it does happen.  When I was between wives (only 2 wifes including my wife, Glenda) I admit to having unprotected sex with a few select women.  I knew all but one of them very well before we even went out together and wasn't concerned.  I should have been more concerned and used protection or both of us getting tested for STDs before becoming intimate.  Protection was used with the one I didn't know well.

 

Anyway, here's the link to a good article published by the government:

 

 

https://us-mg6.mail.yahoo.com/neo/b/message?sMid=3&fid=Inbox&sort=date&order=down&startMid=0&filterB...

 

Please pass it on to everyone you think it might be helpful for.  It gives many ways to bring up the subject with someone before becoming intimate.  It's a tough subject  to approach.  Been there, done that, got the T-shirt.

 

Lyndol

 

Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow is a mystery. Today is a gift. That's why we call it the present. Author Unknown.
"True happiness is ... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future."-- Seneca,
Roman philosopher and playwright
T2 since 1-2013
A1C 6.4 8-2012
6.0 1-2013
6.0 7-2013
6.4 12-2013 :-(
5.9 11-2014 :-)
A1C 5.9 5-2015
Hypertension
Coronary Artery Disease
Low T testosterone injectable 100 mg IM every other week
Lisinopril 2.5 mg daily
Lantus 15 units at bedtime

And I would like to add as diabetics we don't fight off infection as well used too.

Spoiler
__________________________________

Just call me Mary
.
----------------------------------------------------------

Last A1C 6.7 March 2015
Diabetic since 6/2010. Type 2
Humalog sliding scale
Allergic to Levemir back on Lantus 28 units
Allergic to most oral and inject-able diabetic medications. Allergic to most artificial sweeteners. IPMN
Diet and exercise to control blood sugar.





How is diabetes diagnosed: http://www.diabetes.org/diabetes-basics/diagnosis/?referrer=https://www.google.com/
Grief: http://ok.gov/sde/sites/ok.gov.sde/files/Five%20Stages%20of%20Grief.pdf
Depression and diabetes: http://www.diabetes.org/living-with-diabetes/complications/mental-health/depression.html?referrer=https://www.google.com/
Snacks: http://www.diabetesselfmanagement.com/blog/words-to-the-wise-everything-in-moderation/
Lantus dosing: http://www.lantus.com/HCP/dosing-titration/dosing-calculator
How to use insulin: Think Like a Pancreas
Diabetes primer: https://books.google.com/books?id=kNAfrgEACAAJ&source=gbs_book_other_versions Diabetes the first year.


New Mantra: The least amount of food I eat, the healthier I am.
